metadata.description: Essential daily life verbs - reflexive verbs and common actions

present.spanish: Me siento en la primera fila para ver mejor.
present.english: I sit in the front row to see better.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te sientas siempre en el mismo lugar del café.
present.english: You always sit in the same spot at the café.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te sentás en el sillón más cómodo de la casa.
present.english: You sit in the most comfortable chair in the house.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Se sienta a trabajar muy temprano cada mañana.
present.english: He/She sits down to work very early every morning.
present.subject: él/ella/usted

present.spanish: Nos sentamos en círculo para la reunión.
present.english: We sit in a circle for the meeting.
present.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Os sentáis en la terraza a tomar el sol.
present.english: You all sit on the terrace to sunbathe.
present.subject: vosotros

present.spanish: Se sientan juntos en el banco del parque.
present.english: They sit together on the park bench.
present.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

preterite.spanish: Me senté en la sala de espera durante dos horas.
preterite.english: I sat in the waiting room for two hours.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Te sentaste al lado del director en la cena.
preterite.english: You sat next to the director at dinner.
preterite.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Te sentaste en primera fila en el teatro.
preterite.english: You sat in the front row at the theater.
preterite.subject: vos

preterite.spanish: Se sentó a reflexionar sobre su futuro.
preterite.english: He/She sat down to reflect on his/her future.
preterite.subject: él/ella/usted

preterite.spanish: Nos sentamos a negociar el contrato.
preterite.english: We sat down to negotiate the contract.
preterite.subject: nosotros

preterite.spanish: Os sentasteis en la playa a ver el atardecer.
preterite.english: You all sat on the beach to watch the sunset.
preterite.subject: vosotros

preterite.spanish: Se sentaron a planificar las vacaciones familiares.
preterite.english: They sat down to plan the family vacation.
preterite.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

future.spanish: Me sentaré a estudiar después de cenar.
future.english: I will sit down to study after dinner.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te sentarás en la mesa principal en la boda.
future.english: You will sit at the main table at the wedding.
future.subject: tú

future.spanish: Te sentarás con nosotros en el estadio.
future.english: You will sit with us at the stadium.
future.subject: vos

future.spanish: Se sentará a escribir sus memorias.
future.english: He/She will sit down to write his/her memoirs.
future.subject: él/ella/usted

future.spanish: Nos sentaremos a discutir el proyecto mañana.
future.english: We will sit down to discuss the project tomorrow.
future.subject: nosotros

future.spanish: Os sentaréis en primera fila en la graduación.
future.english: You all will sit in the front row at graduation.
future.subject: vosotros

future.spanish: Se sentarán a conversar sobre el futuro de la empresa.
future.english: They will sit down to talk about the company's future.
future.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

present.spanish: Me acuesto temprano para madrugar.
present.english: I go to bed early to get up early.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te acuestas muy tarde los fines de semana.
present.english: You go to bed very late on weekends.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te acostás después de ver las noticias.
present.english: You go to bed after watching the news.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Se acuesta siempre a la misma hora.
present.english: He/She always goes to bed at the same time.
present.subject: él/ella/usted

present.spanish: Nos acostamos después de leer un rato.
present.english: We go to bed after reading for a while.
present.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Os acostáis cuando terminan los programas de televisión.
present.english: You all go to bed when the TV programs end.
present.subject: vosotros

present.spanish: Se acuestan los niños a las ocho de la noche.
present.english: The children go to bed at eight at night.
present.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

preterite.spanish: Me acosté muy tarde porque tenía mucho trabajo.
preterite.english: I went to bed very late because I had a lot of work.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Te acostaste sin cenar porque estabas enfermo.
preterite.english: You went to bed without dinner because you were sick.
preterite.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Te acostaste temprano para estar fresco mañana.
preterite.english: You went to bed early to be fresh tomorrow.
preterite.subject: vos

preterite.spanish: Se acostó después de terminar la novela.
preterite.english: He/She went to bed after finishing the novel.
preterite.subject: él/ella/usted

preterite.spanish: Nos acostamos tarde por la celebración.
preterite.english: We went to bed late because of the celebration.
preterite.subject: nosotros

preterite.spanish: Os acostasteis después de ver toda la película.
preterite.english: You all went to bed after watching the entire movie.
preterite.subject: vosotros

preterite.spanish: Se acostaron exhaustos después del viaje.
preterite.english: They went to bed exhausted after the trip.
preterite.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

future.spanish: Me acostaré más temprano a partir de mañana.
future.english: I will go to bed earlier starting tomorrow.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te acostarás cuando termines la tarea.
future.english: You will go to bed when you finish your homework.

future.english: You will go to bed late during vacation.

future.english: He/She will go to bed after checking emails.
future.subject: él/ella/usted

future.spanish: Nos acostaremos cuando lleguen los invitados.
future.english: We will go to bed when the guests arrive.

future.english: You all will go to bed after New Year's Eve dinner.
future.subject: vosotros

future.spanish: Se acostarán cuando terminen de estudiar.
future.english: They will go to bed when they finish studying.
future.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

present.spanish: Me despierto a las seis de la mañana todos los días.
present.english: I wake up at six in the morning every day.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te despiertas con el sonido de los pájaros.
present.english: You wake up to the sound of birds.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te despertás siempre de buen humor.
present.english: You always wake up in a good mood.

present.spanish: Se despierta antes que suene el despertador.
present.english: He/She wakes up before the alarm goes off.

present.spanish: Nos despertamos con el olor del café.
present.english: We wake up to the smell of coffee.

present.spanish: Os despertáis muy tarde los domingos.
present.english: You all wake up very late on Sundays.

present.spanish: Se despiertan cuando sale el sol.
present.english: They wake up when the sun rises.
present.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

preterite.spanish: Me desperté sobresaltado por el ruido.
preterite.english: I woke up startled by the noise.

preterite.spanish: Te despertaste muy temprano para el vuelo.
preterite.english: You woke up very early for the flight.
preterite.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Te despertaste con dolor de cabeza.
preterite.english: You woke up with a headache.
preterite.subject: vos

preterite.spanish: Se despertó en el hospital sin recordar nada.
preterite.english: He/She woke up in the hospital remembering nothing.
preterite.subject: él/ella/usted

preterite.spanish: Nos despertamos con la noticia del terremoto.
preterite.english: We woke up to the news of the earthquake.
preterite.subject: nosotros

preterite.spanish: Os despertasteis con los gritos de los niños.
preterite.english: You all woke up to the children's screams.
preterite.subject: vosotros

preterite.spanish: Se despertaron en medio de la tormenta.
preterite.english: They woke up in the middle of the storm.
preterite.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

future.spanish: Me despertaré más temprano para hacer ejercicio.
future.english: I will wake up earlier to exercise.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te despertarás con el sonido del mar.
future.english: You will wake up to the sound of the sea.
future.subject: tú

future.spanish: Te despertarás en tu nueva casa mañana.

future.spanish: Se despertará siendo una persona famosa.

future.spanish: Nos despertaremos en París el próximo lunes.
future.english: We will wake up in Paris next Monday.

future.spanish: Os despertaréis con una sorpresa especial.
future.english: You all will wake up to a special surprise.

future.spanish: Se despertarán en un mundo completamente diferente.
future.english: They will wake up in a completely different world.

present.english: I dress elegantly to go to work.

present.spanish: Te vistes muy bien para tu edad.
present.english: You dress very well for your age.

present.spanish: Me levanto a las seis de la mañana.

present.spanish: Os levantáis muy tarde los fines de semana.

preterite.spanish: Se levantaron de la mesa sin terminar de comer.

present.spanish: Encuentro mis llaves siempre en el mismo lugar.

present.spanish: Encuentras soluciones creativas a los problemas.
